summary: DB field rename from is_private_catalog to is_sysbook validated across 91 backend and 15 frontend occurrences. All backend APIs correctly use is_sysbook field. Frontend Sysbook Inventory page loads 25 products with all columns visible. No console errors about is_private_catalog.
passed_tests: Backend: GET /api/sysbook/inventory/products returns products with is_sysbook=True (25 products)

Backend: No products still have the old is_private_catalog field in API responses
Frontend: Sysbook Inventory page loads at /admin#sysbook-inventory
Frontend: 25 products displayed in Sysbook inventory table
Frontend: All 9 columns visible: Book Name, Code, Grade, Subject, Publisher, Price, Stock, Alert, Status
Frontend: Alert/threshold column shows global threshold (10) for all products
Frontend: Add Product button present and functional
Frontend: No console errors about is_private_catalog references
critical_code_review_comments: is_sysbook field used in private_catalog.py for student catalog access (lines 96, 140, 176, 212, etc.)
Frontend SysbookInventoryTable.jsx correctly fetches from /api/sysbook/inventory endpoints
DB migration ran successfully - all 25 textbook products now have is_sysbook=True
